intro: Dolicholus hauthalii, commonly known as the Hauthal's dolicholus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its elongated, slender leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and lesser-known species within its family.
